intro: Ayenia xochipilliae, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange floral displays. The plant features palmate leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Ayenia xochipilliae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
